    • Field Detail

      • BLOCK_SIZE

        public static int BLOCK_SIZE

    • Constructor Detail

      • Volume

        public Volume(java.lang.String path,
              int block_size,
              boolean fill_files)
        This creates an object representing the Volume of the file system image, including a copy of its Group Descriptor an its super block. I advise one put their file system image in the res folder to separate it from the .java files. The directories and files will be loaded.
        Parameters:
        path - This is the file path to the file system image you wish to upload. e.g. src/res/ext2fs.jpg would access the image within the res folder.
        block_size - This is the block size of the file system you wish to upload. This number will be a power of 2.
        fill_files - If true, this Volume will load all files to the folders created in the src folder.

    • Method Detail

      • get_Random_Access_File

        public java.io.RandomAccessFile get_Random_Access_File()
        This returns the RandomAccessFile needed to read this Volume
        Returns:
        This is the RandomAccessFile from which the Volume is loaded.

      • get_inode_block_number

        public int get_inode_block_number(int inode_number)

      • get_subdirectory_inode_numbers_for_all_files

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> get_subdirectory_inode_numbers_for_all_files(int inode_number)
        This will return all the inode numbers of all the files within the directory associated with the inode give.
        Parameters:
        inode_number - This is the inode pointing to the directory from which the inode numbers will be read
        Returns:
        All the inode numbers derived from this directory

      • get_all_filenames

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> get_all_filenames(int inode_number)
        This will return all the file names of all the files within the directory associated with the inode give.
        Parameters:
        inode_number - This is the inode pointing to the directory from which the names will be read
        Returns:
        All the filenames derived from this directory

      • fill_Ext2File

        public void fill_Ext2File(Ext2File file)
        This will read all file data into the Ext2File from its associated blocks
        Parameters:
        file - This is the file we are reading into.
